newsitem.title: BELGIUM: TELINFO AIMS FOR EUROPEAN EXPANSION.
newsitem.headline: TELINFO AIMS FOR EUROPEAN EXPANSION.

text.p: Belgium's Telinfo wants to be a top three network integrator on the European market by the year 2000 and is seeking takeovers on the French and Spanish markets this year, Belgian papers quoted the group as saying.

At a later date Telinfo, a telecommunications and information technology group, wants to strengthen its position in Germany and Switzerland, chief executive officer John Cordier was quoted as telling a news conference in Paris on Friday.

To finance the expansion Telinfo will raise its capital by one billion francs, most likely this autumn. Its main shareholders Sidmar and investors surrounding Cordier would take up their shares of the increase.
Belgian steel maker Sidmar NV, a unit of Luxembourg's Arbed, has 40.6 percent of Telinfo, the Cordier group 28.4 percent.

Cordier was quoted as saying turnover should reach 12 billion to 15 billion francs by 2000 after 6.47 billion in 1996, The share of the Belgo-Luxembourg home market should have dropped to a third by then from 79 percent last year.
Telinfo has a 10 percent stake in Belgium's second GSM mobile phone operator Mobistar, France telecom has 62 percent and Belgian investors have 28 percent.
The company has said it expected 1997 pre-tax profit to rise by 20 percent due to mushrooming use of GSM phones, the Internet and digitalisation.
